H0.text: Weather varies more than climate over a summer.

H1.text: Climate varies more than weather over a summer.

H2.text: Climate varies, but weather stays the same over a summer.

H3.text: Weather and climate vary to the same degree over a summer.

A4.text: Weather refers to day-to-day temperature, precipitation, and other atmospheric conditions, whereas climate is the term for the averaging of atmospheric conditions over longer periods of time.

A5.text: Earth's weather system is a chaotic system; as a result, small changes to one part of the system can grow to have large effects on the system as a whole.
